dt: {bc}a set of instructions for making something (as a food dish) by combining various things

pt: In the Middle Ages, a doctor's instructions for taking a drug would begin with the Latin word {it}recipe{/it}, literally, {ldquo}take!{rdquo} {it}Recipe{/it} is a form used in commands of the verb {it}recipere{/it}, meaning {ldquo}to take{rdquo} or {ldquo}to receive.{rdquo} The verb {it}receive{/it} itself comes from Latin {it}recipere{/it}, but through French—as does the word {it}receipt{/it}, which was once commonly used to mean {ldquo}recipe.{rdquo} From its use as a name for a drug prescription, {it}recipe{/it} extended its meaning to cover instructions for making other things we consume, such as prepared food.
